title: Science vs. Pseudoscience - Siska De Baerdemaeker

options.label: D

options.text: To continually modify a theory to explain away contradictory results.

options.label: B
options.text: To ignore or deny shared data.

options.label: C
options.text: To address internal biases and meaningfully engage in transparent peer review.

options.label: A

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: To ignore or deny shared data.

title: How labor unions shape society - Margaret Levi

options.label: B

options.label: B

options.label: A

options.label: B

multiple-choice.question: What is one of the key challenges facing labor unions today, according to the speaker?

options.label: A
options.text: The rise of automation and technology has made unions obsolete.

options.label: B
options.text: The decline of union jobs in manufacturing has led to a decline in union membership.

options.label: C

multiple-choice.question: What is the speaker's vision for the future of labor unions?

options.label: A
options.text: They should return to their traditional role of negotiating contracts and providing benefits for workers.

options.label: B
options.text: They should evolve to meet the changing needs of workers and the economy, potentially including new forms of organization and cooperation.

options.label: C
options.text: They should be abolished and replaced with alternative forms of worker representation.

options.label: D
options.text: They should remain the same, with no changes or reforms.

multiple-choice.question: What is the potential impact of labor unions on income inequality, according to the speaker?

options.label: A
options.text: They will increase income inequality by giving more power to workers.

options.label: B
options.text: They will reduce income inequality by raising wages and improving working conditions.

options.label: C
options.text: They will have no impact on income inequality.

options.label: D
options.text: They will actually increase income inequality by creating more competition among workers.

multiple-choice.question: What is the speaker's call to action for workers and citizens?

options.label: A
options.text: They should give up on labor unions and focus on individual success.

options.label: B
options.text: They should work to undermine and restrict labor unions.

options.label: C
options.text: They should build solidarity and communities of fate across geographies and differences to support labor unions and promote economic security.

options.label: D

options.label: B

options.label: A
options.text: A condition where humans are unable to recognize faces.

options.label: B
options.text: A condition where humans see faces in all kinds of objects.

options.label: C
options.text: A condition where humans are unable to identify non-face visual stimuli.

options.label: D
options.text: A condition where humans are unable to detect emotions.

options.label: B
options.text: Because humans are unable to recognize faces.

options.label: C
options.text: Because humans are unable to identify non-face visual stimuli.

options.label: D
options.text: Because humans are unable to detect emotions.

options.text: Within a quarter of a second.

options.label: B

options.label: B
options.text: The participant reports not seeing facial features.

options.label: C
options.text: The participant reports seeing a different object.

options.label: D
options.text: The participant reports feeling a different emotion.
